additionalProperties.description: Control schedule configuration for heating and energy systems.

HeatSourceWet.description: Dictionary of available wet heat sources, keyed by user-defined names (e.g., 'boiler', 'hp', 'HeatNetwork', 'hb1'). Other models reference these keys via their heat_source_wet fields.
HeatSourceWet.title: Heatsourcewet

start_day.description: First day of the time series, day of the year, 0 to 365
start_day.title: Start Day

time_series_step.description: Duration in hours (must be within 24-hour period)
time_series_step.title: Time Series Step

Standby.description: Appliance power consumption when not in use (unit: W)
Standby.title: Standby

EnergySupply.description: References a key (e.g., 'mains elec', 'mains gas') in $.EnergySupply
EnergySupply.title: Energysupply

gains_fraction.description: Proportion of appliance demand turned into heat gains (dimensionless, 0-1)
gains_fraction.title: Gains Fraction

loadshifting.description: Load shifting configuration for smart appliance control

priority.description: Priority level for load shifting (lower numbers = higher priority)
priority.title: Priority

schedule.description: Power consumption schedule (one entry per hour)

demand_W.description: Electrical power consumption during the appliance event (unit: W)
demand_W.title: Demand W

duration.description: Duration of the appliance event (unit: hours)
duration.title: Duration

start.description: Hours from start of simulation to when the appliance event begins (unit: hours)
start.title: Start

demand_limit_weighted.description: Value above which the sum demand multiplied by the weight should not exceed. If a 7hr tariff were used for the weight timeseries, then this would be a cost. If this value is 0, then all events will be shifted to the optimal time within the window, otherwise they will be shifted to the earliest time at which the weighted demand goes below the limit. (if there is no time in the window when the weighted demand is belowthe limit, then the optimum is chosen.)
demand_limit_weighted.title: Demand Limit Weighted

max_shift_hrs.description: Maximum time that an event may be shifted away from when it was originally intended to occur. This may be up to 24 hours. (unit: hours)
max_shift_hrs.title: Max Shift Hrs

weight_timeseries.description: This may be, for example, the hourly cost per kWh of a 7hr tariff, but could be any time series. The sum of the other demand and the demand of the appliance in question at any given time is multiplied by the value of this timeseries to obtain a figure that is used to determine whether to shift an event, and when would be the most appropriate time to shift the event to.
weight_timeseries.title: Weight Timeseries

HotWaterSource.description: Reference to HotWaterSource object that provides hot water to this bath. If only one HotWaterSource is defined, then this will be assumed by default
HotWaterSource.title: Hotwatersource

cost_schedule_boiler.description: Cost data for the fuel used by the hybrid's heat pump (can be any units, typically p/kWh)

cost_schedule_hp.description: Cost data for the fuel used by the hybrid's boiler (can be any units, typically p/kWh)

cost_schedule_start_day.description: Day on which the cost data series begins
cost_schedule_start_day.title: Cost Schedule Start Day

cost_schedule_time_series_step.description: Time step of the cost data series
cost_schedule_time_series_step.title: Cost Schedule Time Series Step

area.description: Area of the building element (m²), must be positive if provided
area.title: Area

pitch.description: Tilt angle of the surface from horizontal, between 0 and 180, where 0 means the external surface is facing up, 90 means the external surface is vertical and 180 means the external surface is facing down (unit: ˚)
pitch.title: Pitch

areal_heat_capacity.description: Areal heat capacity (J/m².K), must be positive if provided
areal_heat_capacity.title: Areal Heat Capacity

u_value.description: U-value (W/m²·K), must be positive if provided
u_value.title: U Value

area.title: Area

areal_heat_capacity.description: Areal heat capacity (J/m².K), must be positive if provided
areal_heat_capacity.title: Areal Heat Capacity

u_value.description: U-value (W/m²·K), must be positive if provided
u_value.title: U Value

thermal_resistance_unconditioned_space.description: Effective thermal resistance of unheated space (unit: m².K/W)
thermal_resistance_unconditioned_space.title: Thermal Resistance Unconditioned Space

area.description: Area of this building element within the zone (unit: m²)
area.title: Area

total_area.description: Total area of the building element across entire dwelling; if the Floor is divided among several zones, this is the total area across all zones (unit: m²)
total_area.title: Total Area

perimeter.description: Perimeter of the floor; calculated for the entire ground floor, even if it is distributed among several zones (unit: m)
perimeter.title: Perimeter

areal_heat_capacity.description: Areal heat capacity of the ground floor element (unit: J/m2.K)
areal_heat_capacity.title: Areal Heat Capacity

thermal_resistance_floor_construction.description: Total thermal resistance of all layers in the floor construction (unit: m².K/W)
thermal_resistance_floor_construction.title: Thermal Resistance Floor Construction

u_value.description: Steady-state thermal transmittance of floor, including the effect of the ground (calculated for the entire ground floor, even if it is distributed among several zones) (unit: W/m2.K)
u_value.title: U Value

psi_wall_floor_junc.description: Linear thermal transmittance of the junction between the floor and the walls (unit: W/m.K)
psi_wall_floor_junc.title: Psi Wall Floor Junc

pitch.description: Tilt angle of the surface from horizontal, between 0 and 180, where 0 means the external surface is facing up, 90 means the external surface is vertical and 180 means the external surface is facing down (unit: ˚)
pitch.title: Pitch

height_upper_surface.description: Height of the floor upper surface (unit: m) - average value is used if h varies
height_upper_surface.title: Height Upper Surface

depth_basement_floor.description: Depth of basement floor below ground level (unit: m)
depth_basement_floor.title: Depth Basement Floor

thermal_resist_walls_base.description: Thermal resistance of walls of the basement (unit: m².K/W)
thermal_resist_walls_base.title: Thermal Resist Walls Base

height_basement_walls.description: Height of the basement walls above ground level (unit: m)
height_basement_walls.title: Height Basement Walls

thermal_transm_envi_base.description: Thermal transmittance of floor above basement (unit: W/m².K)

thermal_transm_walls.description: Thermal transmittance of walls above ground (unit: W/m².K)
thermal_transm_walls.title: Thermal Transm Walls

width.description: Width of the building element (m), must be positive if provided

base_height.description: The distance between the ground and the lowest edge of the element (unit: m)
base_height.title: Base Height

frame_area_fraction.description: The frame area fraction of window, ratio of the projected frame area to the overall projected area of the glazed element of the window
frame_area_fraction.title: Frame Area Fraction

free_area_height.description: Height of the openable area, corrected for obstruction due to the window frame of the openable section (unit: m)
free_area_height.title: Free Area Height

g_value.description: Total solar energy transmittance of the transparent part of the window
g_value.title: G Value

max_window_open_area.description: Openable area of the window ignoring the obstructing affect of the frame of the openable part
max_window_open_area.title: Max Window Open Area

mid_height.description: Height of the mid-point of the window, relative to its base (unit: m)
mid_height.title: Mid Height

start_day.description: First day of the time series, day of the year, 0 to 365
start_day.title: Start Day

time_series_step.description: Duration in hours (must be within 24-hour period)
time_series_step.title: Time Series Step

temperatures.description: List of cold water temperatures, one entry per hour (unit: ˚C)
temperatures.title: Temperatures

start_day.description: First day of the time series, day of the year, 0 to 365
start_day.title: Start Day

time_series_step.description: Duration in hours (must be within 24-hour period)
time_series_step.title: Time Series Step

charge_level.description: Proportion of the charge targeted for each day

schedule.description: List of boolean values where true means 'on' (one entry per hour)

temp_charge_cut.description: Temperature at which charging should stop
temp_charge_cut.title: Temp Charge Cut

temp_charge_cut_delta.description: Temperature delta schedule for charge cut-off adjustment (unit: ˚C)

charge_calc_time.description: Indicates from which hour of the day the system starts to target the charge level for the next day rather than the current day
charge_calc_time.title: Charge Calc Time

ControlCombinations.description:
A dictionary of control combinations where:
- Keys are user-defined names (e.g., "main", "week", "weekday", "weekend")
- Values conform to the ControlCombination schema
- The "main" entry is required
ControlCombinations.title: ControlCombinations

start_day.description: First day of the time series, day of the year, 0 to 365
start_day.title: Start Day

time_series_step.description: Duration in hours (must be within 24-hour period)
time_series_step.title: Time Series Step

schedule.description: List of cost values (one entry per time_series_step)

time_on_daily.description: Duration in hours (must be within 24-hour period)
time_on_daily.title: Time On Daily

start_day.description: First day of the time series, day of the year, 0 to 365
start_day.title: Start Day

time_series_step.description: Duration in hours (must be within 24-hour period)
time_series_step.title: Time Series Step

schedule.description: List of boolean values where true means on, one entry per hour

start_day.description: First day of the time series, day of the year, 0 to 365
start_day.title: Start Day

time_series_step.description: Duration in hours (must be within 24-hour period)
time_series_step.title: Time Series Step

advanced_start.description: How long before heating period the system should switch on (unit: hours)
advanced_start.title: Advanced Start

default_to_max.description: If both min and max limits are set but setpoint is not, whether to default to min (false) or max (true)
default_to_max.title: Default To Max

schedule.description: Setpoint schedule with one entry per timestep

edge_thermal_resistance.description: Thermal resistance of floor edge insulation (unit: m²K/W)
edge_thermal_resistance.title: Edge Thermal Resistance

edge_thermal_resistance.description: Thermal resistance of floor edge insulation (unit: m²K/W)
edge_thermal_resistance.title: Edge Thermal Resistance

battery_age.description: The starting age of the battery (in years)
battery_age.title: Battery Age

capacity.description: The maximum capacity of the battery (unit: kWh)
capacity.title: Capacity

charge_discharge_efficiency_round_trip.description: Charge/discharge round trip efficiency of battery system (greater than 0, up to 1)
charge_discharge_efficiency_round_trip.title: Charge Discharge Efficiency Round Trip

grid_charging_possible.description: Is charging from the grid possible?
grid_charging_possible.title: Grid Charging Possible

maximum_charge_rate_one_way_trip.description: The maximum charge rate one way trip the battery allows (unit: kW)
maximum_charge_rate_one_way_trip.title: Maximum Charge Rate One Way Trip

maximum_discharge_rate_one_way_trip.description: The maximum discharge rate one way trip the battery allows (unit: kW)
maximum_discharge_rate_one_way_trip.title: Maximum Discharge Rate One Way Trip

minimum_charge_rate_one_way_trip.description: The minimum charge rate one way trip the battery allows (unit: kW)
minimum_charge_rate_one_way_trip.title: Minimum Charge Rate One Way Trip

Controlmax.description: Reference to a control schedule of maximum temperature setpoints. References a key in $.Control.
Controlmax.title: Controlmax

ElectricBattery.description: Indicates that an electric battery is present

diverter.description: Indicates that the supply has a diverter

is_export_capable.description: Denotes that this energy supply can export its surplus supply
is_export_capable.title: Is Export Capable

anyOf.description: Level of battery charge above which grid prohibited from charging battery (monthly values) (0 - 1)
Grid price below which battery is permitted to charge from grid (monthly values) (unit: p/kWh)

air_temperatures.description: List of external air temperatures, one entry per hour (unit: ˚C)
air_temperatures.title: Air Temperatures

diffuse_horizontal_radiation.description: List of diffuse horizontal radiation values, one entry per hour (unit: W/m²)
diffuse_horizontal_radiation.title: Diffuse Horizontal Radiation

direct_beam_conversion_needed.description: A flag to indicate whether direct beam radiation from climate data needs to be converted from horizontal to normal incidence; if normal direct beam radiation values are provided then no conversion is needed
direct_beam_conversion_needed.title: Direct Beam Conversion Needed

direct_beam_radiation.description: List of direct beam radiation values, one entry per hour (unit: W/m²)
direct_beam_radiation.title: Direct Beam Radiation

latitude.description: Latitude of weather station, angle from south (unit: ˚)
latitude.title: Latitude

longitude.description: Longitude of weather station, easterly +ve westerly -ve (unit: ˚)
longitude.title: Longitude

shading_segments.description: Data splitting the ground plane into segments (8-36) and giving height and distance to shading objects surrounding the building
shading_segments.title: Shading Segments

items.description: The fraction of solar radiation incident on the ground that is reflected. Also called the albedo.

solar_reflectivity_of_ground.description: List of ground reflectivity values, 0 to 1, one entry per hour
solar_reflectivity_of_ground.title: Solar Reflectivity Of Ground

items.description: The orientation angle of the inclined surface, expressed as the geographical azimuth angle of the horizontal projection of the inclined surface normal, 0 to 360 (unit: ˚)

wind_directions.description: List of wind directions in degrees where North=0, East=90, South=180, West=270. Values range: 0 to 360. Wind direction is reported by the direction from which it originates, e.g. a southerly (180 degree) wind blows from the south to the north. (unit: ˚)
wind_directions.title: Wind Directions

wind_speeds.description: List of wind speeds, one entry per hour (unit: m/s)
wind_speeds.title: Wind Speeds

temperature.description: External temperature data point for the corresponding maximum charge level (unit: Celsius)
temperature.title: Temperature

max_charge.description: Maximum charge level permitted by the control for a given external temperature
max_charge.title: Max Charge

power_output.description: Heat output for a specific test temperature difference (unit: kW)
power_output.title: Power Output

temperature_diff.description: Difference in temperature between the hot water supplied to the fan coil and the air in the room (unit: Kelvin)
temperature_diff.title: Temperature Diff

fan_power_W.description: A list of fan powers for which heat output data is provided (unit: W)
fan_power_W.title: Fan Power W

HeatPumpBoiler.description: Boiler used as backup for heat pump systems

EnergySupply.description: References a key (e.g., 'mains elec', 'mains gas') in $.EnergySupply
EnergySupply.title: Energysupply

EnergySupply_aux.description: References a key in $.EnergySupply for auxiliary electrical power
EnergySupply_aux.title: Energysupply Aux

boiler_location.description: Location of the boiler (internal or external to the building)

electricity_circ_pump.description: Electrical power consumption of circulation pump (unit: kW)
electricity_circ_pump.title: Electricity Circ Pump

electricity_full_load.description: Electrical power consumption at full load (unit: kW)
electricity_full_load.title: Electricity Full Load

electricity_part_load.description: Electrical power consumption at part load (unit: kW)
electricity_part_load.title: Electricity Part Load

electricity_standby.description: Electrical power consumption in standby mode (unit: kW)
electricity_standby.title: Electricity Standby

rated_power.description: Rated power output of the boiler (unit: kW)
rated_power.title: Rated Power

HeatPumpBoiler.title: HeatPumpBoiler

pump_fixed_flow_rate.description: Flow rate of the buffer tank - emitters loop (unit: l/min)
pump_fixed_flow_rate.title: Pump Fixed Flow Rate

pump_power_at_flow_rate.description: Pump power of the buffer tank - emitters loop (unit: W)
pump_power_at_flow_rate.title: Pump Power At Flow Rate

volume.description: Volume of the buffer tank (unit: litre)
volume.title: Volume

Controlmax.description: Reference to a control schedule of maximum temperature setpoints. References a key in $.Control.
Controlmax.title: Controlmax

Controlmin.description: Reference to a control schedule of minimum temperature setpoints. References a key in $.Control.
Controlmin.title: Controlmin

EnergySupply.description: References a key (e.g., 'mains elec', 'mains gas') in $.EnergySupply
EnergySupply.title: Energysupply

heat_exchanger_surface_area_declared.description: Surface area of heat exchanger stored in the database (unit: m2)
heat_exchanger_surface_area_declared.title: Heat Exchanger Surface Area Declared

heater_position.description: Vertical position of the heater within the tank, as a fraction of the tank height (0 = bottom, 1 = top). Dimensionless.
heater_position.title: Heater Position

in_use_factor_mismatch.description: In use factor to be applied to heat pump efficiency
in_use_factor_mismatch.title: In Use Factor Mismatch

tank_volume_declared.description: Tank volume stored in the database (unit: litres)
tank_volume_declared.title: Tank Volume Declared

test_data.description: Dictionary with keys denoting tapping profile letter (M or L)

thermostat_position.description: Vertical position of the thermostat within the tank, as a fraction of the tank height (0 = bottom, 1 = top). Dimensionless. Required for StorageTank but not for SmartHotWaterTank.
thermostat_position.title: Thermostat Position

vol_hw_daily_average.description: Annual average hot water use for the dwelling (unit: litres/day)
vol_hw_daily_average.title: Vol Hw Daily Average

energy_input_measured.description: Electrical input energy measured in EN 16147 test over 24 hrs (unit: kWh)
energy_input_measured.title: Energy Input Measured

- No specific entries are required - all entries are optional and user-defined
- Note: Despite the name, this container includes both gains and losses

ScheduleEntryForBoolean.description:
A schedule entry that can be a direct value, repeating pattern, or reference.

Examples:
    # Direct boolean value
    true

    # Repeating pattern (heating on for 8 hours, off for 16 hours)
    {"repeat": 24, "value": true}

    # Reference to another schedule
    "weekday_heating_schedule"

    # Complex repeating pattern with reference
    {"repeat": 7, "value": "daily_pattern"}
ScheduleEntryForBoolean.title: ScheduleEntryForBoolean

ScheduleEntryForDouble.description:
A schedule entry that can be a direct value, repeating pattern, or reference.

Examples:
    # Direct float value (temperature setpoint)
    21.5

    # Repeating pattern (21.5°C for 8 hours, 18°C for 16 hours)
    {"repeat": 24, "value": 21.5}

    # Reference to another schedule
    "weekday_temp_schedule"

    # Complex repeating pattern with reference
    {"repeat": 7, "value": "daily_temp_pattern"}

    # Power level schedule
    2.5  # 2.5 kW constant power
ScheduleEntryForDouble.title: ScheduleEntryForDouble

ScheduleForBoolean.description:
A dictionary of schedule entries where:
- Keys are user-defined names (e.g., "main", "week", "weekday", "weekend")
- Values are lists of ScheduleEntryForBoolean
- The "main" entry is required
ScheduleForBoolean.title: ScheduleForBoolean

ScheduleForDegreesCelsius.description:
A dictionary of temperature schedule entries where:
- Keys are user-defined names (e.g., "main", "week", "weekend")
- Values are lists of ScheduleEntryForDegreesCelsius
- The "main" entry is required
ScheduleForDegreesCelsius.title: ScheduleForDegreesCelsius

ScheduleForDouble.description:
A dictionary of schedule entries where:
- Keys are user-defined names (e.g., "main", "week", "weekday", "weekend")
- Values are lists of ScheduleEntryForDouble
- The "main" entry is required
ScheduleForDouble.title: ScheduleForDouble

thermostat_position.description: Vertical position of the thermostat within the tank, as a fraction of the tank height (0 = bottom, 1 = top). Dimensionless. Required for StorageTank but not for SmartHotWaterTank.
thermostat_position.title: Thermostat Position

tilt.description: Tilt angle (inclination) of the PV panel from horizontal, measured upwards facing, 0 to 90, in degrees. 0=horizontal surface, 90=vertical surface. Needed to calculate solar irradiation at the panel surface.
tilt.title: Tilt

EnergySupply.description: References a key (e.g., 'mains elec', 'mains gas') in $.EnergySupply
EnergySupply.title: Energysupply

cooling_capacity.description: Maximum cooling capacity of the system (unit: kW)
cooling_capacity.title: Cooling Capacity

efficiency.description: Efficiency of the air conditioning system. SEER (Seasonal energy efficiency ratio)
efficiency.title: Efficiency

dry_core_max_output.description: Maximum output of the electric storage heater. (Unit: kW) Data from test showing the output from the storage heater when it is actively outputting heat, e.g. damper open / fan running.
dry_core_max_output.title: Dry Core Max Output

dry_core_min_output.description: Minimum output of the electric storage heater. (Unit: kW) Data from test showing the output from the storage heater when not actively outputting heat, i.e. case losses only
dry_core_min_output.title: Dry Core Min Output

EnergySupply.description: References a key (e.g., 'mains elec', 'mains gas') in $.EnergySupply
EnergySupply.title: Energysupply

n_units.description: Number of units installed in the zone.
n_units.title: N Units

pwr_in.description: The rated power of the heating element which charges the storage medium with heat (unit: kW)
pwr_in.title: Pwr In

state_of_charge_init.description: State of charge at initialisation of dry core heat storage (ratio)
state_of_charge_init.title: State Of Charge Init

rated_power_instant.description: The rated power output of the instantaneous backup heater (unit: kW)
rated_power_instant.title: Rated Power Instant

storage_capacity.description: Storage capacity of the electric storage heater. (Unit: kWh)
storage_capacity.title: Storage Capacity

Zone.description: The zone where the unit(s) is/are installed. References a key in $.Zone.
Zone.title: Zone

temp_flow_limit_upper.description: Upper operating limit for temperature (unit: deg C)
temp_flow_limit_upper.title: Temp Flow Limit Upper

EnergySupply.description: References a key (e.g., 'mains elec', 'mains gas') in $.EnergySupply
EnergySupply.title: Energysupply

rated_power.description: Rated power of the instant electric heater. (Unit: kW)
rated_power.title: Rated Power

bypass_fraction_recirculated.description: Fraction of return back into flow water
bypass_fraction_recirculated.title: Bypass Fraction Recirculated

design_flow_rate.description: Constant flow rate if the heat source can't modulate flow rate (unit: l/s)
design_flow_rate.title: Design Flow Rate

emitters.description: Wet emitter details of the heating system.
emitters.title: Emitters

temp_diff_emit_dsgn.description: Design temperature difference across the emitters. (Unit: deg C or K)
temp_diff_emit_dsgn.title: Temp Diff Emit Dsgn

thermal_mass.description: Thermal mass of the emitters. (Unit: kWh/K)
thermal_mass.title: Thermal Mass

variable_flow.description: Whether the heat source can modulate flow rate.
variable_flow.title: Variable Flow

anyOf.description: References a key (e.g., 'mains elec', 'mains gas') in $.EnergySupply

Zone.description: Zone in which the emitters are located. References a key in $.Zone
Zone.title: Zone

HeatSource.description: Dictionary of heating systems connected to the storage tank
HeatSource.title: Heatsource

daily_losses.description: Measured standby losses due to cylinder insulation at standardised conditions (unit: kWh/24h)
daily_losses.title: Daily Losses

heat_exchanger_surface_area.description: Surface area of the heat exchanger within the storage tank (unit: m²)
heat_exchanger_surface_area.title: Heat Exchanger Surface Area

init_temp.description: Initial temperature of the storage tank at the start of simulation (unit: ˚C)
init_temp.title: Init Temp

primary_pipework.description: List of primary pipework components connected to the storage tank
primary_pipework.title: Primary Pipework

length.description: Length of the thermal bridge over which the linear thermal transmittance applies. (Unit: m)
length.title: Length

linear_thermal_transmittance.description: Linear thermal transmittance of the thermal bridge. (Unit: W/m.K)
linear_thermal_transmittance.title: Linear Thermal Transmittance

heat_transfer_coeff.description: Heat transfer coefficient of the thermal bridge. (Unit: W/K)
heat_transfer_coeff.title: Heat Transfer Coeff

area_cm2.description: Equivalent area of a vent (unit: cm2)
area_cm2.title: Area Cm2

mid_height_air_flow_path.description: Mid height of air flow path relative to ventilation zone (unit: m)
mid_height_air_flow_path.title: Mid Height Air Flow Path

orientation360.description: The orientation angle of the inclined surface, expressed as the geographical azimuth angle of the horizontal projection of the inclined surface normal, 0 to 360 (unit: ˚)
orientation360.title: Orientation360

pitch.description: Tilt angle of the surface from horizontal, between 0 and 180, where 0 means the external surface is facing up, 90 means the external surface is vertical and 180 means the external surface is facing down (unit: ˚)
pitch.title: Pitch

pressure_difference_ref.description: Reference pressure difference for an air terminal device (unit: Pa)
pressure_difference_ref.title: Pressure Difference Ref

env_area.description: Reference area of the envelope airtightness index
env_area.title: Env Area

WWHRSConfiguration.description:
WWHRS system configuration

A - Both shower and water heating system get pre-heated water
B - Only shower gets pre-heated water
C - Only water heating system gets pre-heated water
WWHRSConfiguration.title: WWHRSConfiguration

flow_rates.description: Test flow rates in litres per minute (e.g., [5, 7, 9, 11, 13])
flow_rates.title: Flow Rates

system_a_efficiencies.description: Measured efficiencies for System A at the test flow rates
system_a_efficiencies.title: System A Efficiencies

system_b_efficiencies.description: Measured efficiencies for System B (optional, uses system_b_efficiency_factor if not provided)
system_b_efficiencies.title: System B Efficiencies

system_b_utilisation_factor.description: Utilisation factor for System B. Required when using either system_b_efficiencies (pre-corrected data) or when converting system_a_efficiencies to System B (used with system_b_efficiency_factor).
system_b_utilisation_factor.title: System B Utilisation Factor

system_c_efficiencies.description: Measured efficiencies for System C (optional, uses system_c_efficiency_factor if not provided)
system_c_efficiencies.title: System C Efficiencies

system_c_utilisation_factor.description: Utilisation factor for System C. Required when using either system_c_efficiencies (pre-corrected data) or when converting system_a_efficiencies to System C (used with system_c_efficiency_factor).
system_c_utilisation_factor.title: System C Utilisation Factor

system_b_efficiency_factor.description: Reduction factor for converting System A efficiency data to System B (default 0.81). Only used when system_b_efficiencies is not provided.
system_b_efficiency_factor.title: System B Efficiency Factor

system_c_efficiency_factor.description: Reduction factor for converting System A efficiency data to System C (default 0.88). Only used when system_c_efficiencies is not provided.
system_c_efficiency_factor.title: System C Efficiency Factor

duration.description: Duration of the water heating event (unit: minutes)
duration.title: Duration

start.description: Hours from start of simulation to when the water heating event begins (unit: hours)
start.title: Start

temperature.description: Target temperature for the water heating event (unit: ˚C)
temperature.title: Temperature

volume.description: Volume of water for the event (unit: litre)
volume.title: Volume

Shower.description: Dictionary of shower water heating events, where keys are shower names and values are lists of events
Shower.title: Shower

Bath.description: Dictionary of bath water heating events, where keys are bath names and values are lists of events
Bath.title: Bath

Other.description: Dictionary of other water heating events (e.g., taps, sinks), where keys are event names and values are lists of events
Other.title: Other

insulation_thermal_conductivity.description: Thermal conductivity of the insulation (unit: W / m K)
insulation_thermal_conductivity.title: Insulation Thermal Conductivity

location.description: Location of the pipework (internal or external)

pipe_contents.description: Contents of the pipework (water or glycol25)

n_units.description: Number of units of this specification of fancoil in Zone
n_units.title: N Units

c.description: Constant from characteristic equation of emitters (e.g. derived from BS EN 442 tests)
c.title: C

c_per_m.description: Constant from characteristic equation of emitters (e.g. derived from BS EN 442 tests) per the length of the emitter
c_per_m.title: C Per M

length.description: The length of the emitter (unit: m)
length.title: Length

n.description: Exponent from characteristic equation of emitters (e.g. derived from BS EN 442 tests)
n.title: N

equivalent_specific_thermal_mass.description: Equivalent thermal mass per m² of floor area for under-floor heating systems (unit: kJ/m²K)
equivalent_specific_thermal_mass.title: Equivalent Specific Thermal Mass

system_performance_factor.description: Heat output per m² of floor area for under-floor heating systems (unit: W/m²K)
system_performance_factor.title: System Performance Factor

Control_closing_irrad.description: Irradiation level above which the window treatment is assumed to be closed (unit: W/m²). References a key in $.Control.
Control_closing_irrad.title: Control Closing Irrad

Control_open.description: reference to a time control object containing a schedule of booleans describing when a window treatment is open. References a key in $.Control.
Control_open.title: Control Open

Control_opening_irrad.description: Irradiation level below which a window treatment is assumed to be open (unit: W/m²). References a key in $.Control.
Control_opening_irrad.title: Control Opening Irrad

delta_r.description: Additional thermal resistance provided by a window treatment (unit: m²K/W)
delta_r.title: Delta R

is_open.description: A boolean describing the state of the window treatment
is_open.title: Is Open

opening_delay_hrs.description: Time delay enforced before a window treatment may be opened after the conditions for its opening are met (unit: hours)
opening_delay_hrs.title: Opening Delay Hrs

trans_red.description: Dimensionless factor describing the reduction in the amount of transmitted radiation due to a window treatment
trans_red.title: Trans Red

BuildingElement.description: Dictionary of building elements present in the zone (e.g. walls, floors, windows, etc.).
BuildingElement.title: Buildingelement

SpaceCoolSystem.description: Cooling system details of the zone. References a key in $.SpaceCoolSystem
SpaceCoolSystem.title: Spacecoolsystem

SpaceHeatSystem.description: Heating system details of the zone. References a key in $.SpaceHeatSystem
SpaceHeatSystem.title: Spaceheatsystem

ThermalBridging.description: Overall heat transfer coefficient of the thermal bridge (in W/K), or dictionary of linear thermal transmittance details of the thermal bridges in the zone.
ThermalBridging.title: Thermalbridging

area.description: Useful floor area of the zone. (Unit: m²)
area.title: Area

temp_setpnt_init.description: Setpoint temperature to use during initialisation (unit: ˚C)
temp_setpnt_init.title: Temp Setpnt Init

volume.description: Total volume of the zone. (Unit: m³)
volume.title: Volume
